page.title: 17Adisham: Entertainment
page.content: Adisham village provides little in the way of entertainment. About eight dances a year are held in the hall, which is also used for wedding receptions and parties. A flourishing drama group has recently collapsed without a producer. The public house provides live music most evenings. The life style of the younger members of the community and their ownership of cars means that enter- tainment is mainly sought outside, although some go by train. Cinemas in nearby towns are used, and theatres or concert halls as far afield as London. Visiting friends and relatives for a meal is the most common form of enter- taining, with meals at a restaurant very popular. Holidays were taken at home or abroad, and caravans were taken abroad, especially by families with children.
